tips.concept: Bubble sort can stop early if no swaps occur.
tips.why: Early stopping optimizes best-case time to O(n).
tips.challenge: Add a swapped flag and test on a sorted array.

mcqs.explanation: With no swaps, only one pass is needed.

assignments.title: Bubble Sort Optimization

assignments.solution: Use a swapped flag to break when array is sorted.

tips.concept: Selection sort always performs O(n²) comparisons.
tips.why: It does not adapt to sorted data.
svgs: <svg viewBox='0 0 600 140'><rect width='600' height='140' rx='18' fill='#fff2cc'/><text x='50%' y='55%' text-anchor='middle' font-size='22' fill='#6b3a00'>Selection Sort Always Compares</text></svg>

mcqs.q: Selection sort comparison count depends on input?
mcqs.explanation: It always scans the remaining array.

assignments.title: Selection Sort Analysis
assignments.task: Explain why selection sort is not adaptive.
assignments.solution: It performs comparisons regardless of order.

tips.concept: Insertion sort is efficient for nearly sorted arrays.
tips.why: Shifts are minimal when elements are close to position.
